result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:12 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Joseph Andrew Jacobson in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Joseph Andrew Jacobson.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF86, 22CF135, 22TR532 and 22TR533. Set for motion hearing in case 22CF135. records.addlTxt:
TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF86, 22CF135, 22TR532 & 22TR533:
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Joseph Andrew Jacobson appeared. Case called at 9:38 a.m. Court notes 22CF86 is scheduled for arraignment. Atty Harrelson has a copy of information.   Understands charges. Waives further reading. NG plea entered. Preserves all pre plea rights.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF86 (PH), 22CF135 (ARGN), 22TR532 & 22TR533 (PTC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Joseph Andrew Jacobson appeared. Case called at 10:03 a.m. Court notes 22CF86 is scheduled for a preliminary hearing. ADA Becker calls Officer Dishno to the Stand. S/T Michael Dishno. Employed with the Baldwin Police Department. Direct by ADA Becker. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Becker. Witness excused. No further evidence by either party. ADA Becker requesting bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial in 22CF86. ADA Becker requesting matter be scheduled for arraignment. In 22CF135, Atty Harrelson has received a copy of the information. DE understands charges and penalties. Enters a NG plea on all Counts, reserving on jurisdictional objections. Waives speedy trial. Court schedules. Atty Harrelson requesting arraignment be scheduled out past 30 days. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Court adjourned at 10:25 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
of Judge, filed by Atty Harrelson.    Per EFV on 3-9-2022: "I'll administratively transfer this case to Branch 4. No need to substitute" JA will transfer and let Atty. Harrelson know.  mw
Filed by Justice Support Services. mw                to rg
Filed by ADA Ballo. mw
Arraignment on March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:36 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel   ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Joseph Andrew Jacobson appeared.  S/T Captain Justin Johnson, SCSO; direct by Atty Ellenwood. Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Harrleson. Atty Harrelson asks court to take judicial notice of the bond in 22CF86; court takes notice. Atty Harrelson moves to dismiss Ct 1, argues bindover. Atty Ellenwood responds as to bindover on all counts. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court sets STC with 22CF86 PH. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned at: 3:51 pm.  Arraignment scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Back on record at: 3:52 pm. Atty Harrelson makes statements as to UA testing on 22CF86 and SCRAM testing 4x/day on this bond. Court modifies bond in 22CF86 to match Scram testing to mirror 22CF135 and removes UA testing. Adjourned at: 3:56 pm.
Pretrial Assessment report. Filed by JSC. arc
Filed by Atty Harrelson. km

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Harrelson. km
Filed by JSC. km               to rg
22R 002901. $1,000 posted by DEF. cah
Preliminary hearing on March 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 4 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

01:38 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF: Joseph Andrew Jacobson appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Atty Harrelson motions to dismiss Count 1. Court references 21CF286.  Court DENIES motion at this time. Court orders bond. Court sets PH with Court Commissioner. Adjourned 01:48 PM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
